item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, September 6, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Porting systemd to musl libc-powered Linux (57 points | 20 comments)
2. The Moral Implications of Being a Moderately Successful Computer Scientist and a Woman (44 points | 2 comments)
3. Is Linux collapsing under its own weight? On Rust for Linux (28 points | 86 comments)

5. Announcing Rust 1.81.0 (18 points | 3 comments)
6. Swift is a more convenient Rust (7 points | 5 comments)
7. Async Rust can be a pleasure to work with (without `Send + Sync + 'static`) (68 points | 41 comments)
8. My most downvoted StackOverflow answer (14 points | 6 comments)
9. Intuiting Monty Hall (5 points | 14 comments)
10. The Internet Archive Loses Its Appeal of a Major Copyright Case (20 points | 11 comments)
11. Building a WoW server in Elixir (7 points | 4 comments)
12. Exercism has 2M users but no money in the bank (11 points | 1 comment)
13. Clojure 1.12.0 is released (7 points | 1 comment)
14. Dynamicland (44 points | 15 comments)
15. Cron Jobs on Linux - Comprehensive Guide with Examples (1 points | 1 comment)
16. QEMU version 9.1.0 released (13 points | 4 comments)
17. How we build forms in LiveView + LiveSvelte (2 points | no comments)
18. An Optimization That's Impossible in Rust (17 points | 3 comments)
19. LazyFS: A FUSE Filesystem with an internal dedicated page cache, which can be used to simulate data loss on unsynced writes (12 points | no comments)
20. AlphaProteo generates novel proteins for biology and health research (1 points | no comments)
21. Postgres Materialized Views from Parquet in S3 with Zero ETL (4 points | 1 comment)
22. TUI for lobste.rs website (38 points | 4 comments)
23. Twelve rules for job applications and interviews (19 points | 10 comments)
24. pdqselect: Pattern-Defeating QuickSelect for Go (3 points | no comments)
25. Giving C++ std::regex a C makeover (9 points | 7 comments)
